issues.title: transcription_output_topic is not in RoomOutputOptions as documented
issues.body:
Hello! Thanks for taking the time to read the report.

`transcription_output_topic` is not in RoomOutputOptions class as documented (python v1.0 custom-topics) here: 
https://docs.livekit.io/agents/build/text/#custom-topics

> You may override the text_input_topic of RoomInputOptions and **transcription_output_topic of RoomOutputOptions** to set a custom text stream topic for text input or output, if desired. The default values are lk.chat and lk.transcription respectively.



Also I can't find a way to use custom-topics too, in RoomOutputOptions class 
https://github.com/livekit/agents/blob/7730835292f990d5a3835d9c1aae5b71fa8695c4/livekit-agents/livekit/agents/voice/room_io/room_io.py#L76-L84

I was trying to make an agent to chat like chatGPT UI in the chat box.
To do so, i need to specifically use text streams topic `lk.chat`, instead of the default `lk.transcription`, to have an interactive chat box. Am i correct?
```
session = AgentSession(
    ...,
    room_output_options=RoomOutputOptions(
        transcription_output_topic='lk.chat'
    )
)
```
Thanks
issues.author: Denly

comments.author: longcw
comments.body:
`transcription_output_topic` is not exposed, it's always `lk.transcription`. We will update the document.

For text input from user, you can use `lk.chat` topic, and listen to the `lk.transcription` for the agent transcription and user transcription from audio recognition.

issues.title: Distributed LiveKit: Agent worker can only serve the node it registered on
issues.body:
## Summary

In a 3-node LiveKit cluster, a single **LiveKit Agent worker** registers successfully on **Node C**.
 When a new room request lands on **Node B**, the server cannot hand that job to the worker on Node C. Instead it

1. Tries (and fails) to assign the job on Node B.
2. Falls back to **Node A**, which creates the room **without any Agent worker attached**.

Result: the room starts, but the Agent never connects and hence there is only silence.


------

## Topology

```
Node A â”€â”€ LiveKit server
Node B â”€â”€ LiveKit server              (receives the room request)
Node C â”€â”€ LiveKit server              (worker registers here)
```

------

## Logs

## Node A
```
2025-05-06T05:42:55.411Z  INFO  livekit  service/roomallocator.go:164  selected node for room  {"room":"<room_name>","selectedNodeID":"<livekit_node_id>"}

2025-05-06T05:42:55.646Z  INFO  livekit  agent/client.go:161  failed to send job request  {"error":"no workers with sufficient capacity","namespace":"","jobType":"JT_ROOM","agentName":""}
2025-05-06T05:42:56.493Z  INFO  livekit  service/roommanager.go:405  starting RTC session  {"room":"<room_name>","roomID":"<room_id>","participant":"<participant_id>","pID":"<process_id>","remote":false,"nodeID":"<livekit_node_id>","numParticipants":0,"participantInit":{"Identity":"<participant_id>","Client":{"sdk":"<sdk>","version":"<sdk_version>","os":"<os>","osVersion":"<os_version>","deviceModel":"<device_model>","browser":"<browser>","browserVersion":"<browser_version>"}}}
2025-05-06T05:42:56.496Z  INFO  livekit  service/roommanager.go:938  created TURN password  {"username":"<turn_username>","password":"<turn_pass>"}
2025-05-06T05:42:56.808Z  INFO  livekit.transport  rtc/transport.go:546  ice reconnected or switched pair  {"room":"<room_name>","roomID":"<room_id>","participant":"<participant_id>","pID":"<process_id>","remote":false,"transport":"PUBLISHER","existingPair":{"localProtocol":"udp","localCandidateType":"host","localAddress":"<local_ip>","localPort":"<local_port>","remoteProtocol":"udp","remoteCandidateType":"prflx","remoteAddress":"<remote_ip>","remotePort":"<remote_port>"},"newPair":{"localProtocol":"udp","localCandidateType":"host","localAddress":"<local_ipv6>","localPort":"<local_ipv6_port>","remoteProtocol":"udp","remoteCandidateType":"host","remoteAddress":"<remote_ipv6>","remotePort":"<remote_ipv6_port>"}}}

2025-05-06T05:42:56.957Z  INFO  livekit.webhook  webhook/url_notifier.go:124  sent webhook  {"event":"track_published","id":"<event_id>","webhookTime":1346510176,"room":"<room_name>","roomID":"<room_id>","participant":"<participant_id>","pID":"<process_id>","url":"<webhook_url>","queueDuration":"14.513Âµs","sendDuration":"32.059281ms"}

2025-05-06T05:42:57.744Z  INFO  livekit.webhook  webhook/url_notifier.go:124  sent webhook  {"event":"participant_joined","id":"<event_id>","webhookTime":1346510177,"room":"<room_name>","roomID":"<room_id>","participant":"<participant_id>","pID":"<process_id>","url":"<webhook_url>","queueDuration":"34.951Âµs","sendDuration":"39.824442ms"}
```

### Node B
```
2025-05-06T05:42:55.632Z	WARN	livekit.agents	service/agentservice.go:401	failed to assign job to worker	{"jobID": "<job_id>", "namespace": "", "agentName": "", "jobType": "JT_ROOM", "room": "<room_name>", "roomID": "<room_id>", "workerID": "<OLD_WORKER_ID_1>", "retry": true, "error": "worker not available"}
2025-05-06T05:42:55.639Z	WARN	livekit.agents	service/agentservice.go:401	failed to assign job to worker	{"jobID": "<job_id>", "namespace": "", "agentName": "", "jobType": "JT_ROOM", "room": "<room_name>", "roomID": "<room_id>", "workerID": "<OLD_WORKER_ID_2>", "retry": true, "error": "worker not available"}
2025-05-06T05:42:55.644Z	WARN	livekit.agents	service/agentservice.go:401	failed to assign job to worker	{"jobID": "<job_id>", "namespace": "", "agentName": "", "jobType": "JT_ROOM", "room": "<room_name>", "roomID": "<room_id>", "workerID": "<OLD_WORKER_ID_3>", "retry": true, "error": "worker not available"}
2025-05-06T05:42:55.644Z	WARN	livekit.agents	service/agentservice.go:391	no worker available to handle job	{"jobID": "<job_id>", "namespace": "", "agentName": "", "jobType": "JT_ROOM", "room": "<room_name>", "roomID": "<room_id>", "error": "no workers with sufficient capacity"}
```

### Node C
```
2025-05-06T05:42:44.567Z	INFO	livekit.agents	service/agentservice.go:292	worker registered	{"namespace": "", "jobType": "JT_ROOM", "agentName": "", "workerID": "<CORRECT_WORKED_ID>"}
```

------

## Expected behavior

- **Node B** should be able to dispatch the `JT_ROOM` job to the worker already
   registered on **Node C**, or the cluster should transparently proxy the request.

## Actual behavior

- **Node B** fails to find *any* available worker and eventually the allocator
   selects **Node A**, which creates the room without an Agent worker.

------

## Reproduction steps

1. Run three LiveKit nodes (A, B, C) backed by the same Redis/state store (running in sentinel with one master node).
2. Start **one** Agent worker *only* on Node C (job type `JT_ROOM`).
3. Send a `CreateRoom` request that the allocator routes to Node B.
4. Observe *worker-not-available* warnings on Node B and room creation on Node A.

------

## Environment

| Component      | Version                                 |
| -------------- | --------------------------------------- |
| LiveKit server | `v2.8.0`                                |
| LiveKit Agent  | `v0.x` (worker)                       |
| Redis          | `7.2`                                   |
| Deployment     | Docker Compose (one container per node) |
| OS             | Ubuntu 22.04                            |

------

## Question

**Why canâ€™t Node B delegate the job to the registered worker on Node C?**
 Is worker discovery limited to the local node by design, or is there an extra
 configuration flag required to make workers globally visible across the cluster?

Any insight or pointers would be greatly appreciated!


Note: This is a duplicate of the issue in the [LiveKit repo](https://github.com/livekit/livekit/issues/3645). I can close the other issue once I know which repo is the right place to ask this.

issues.title: FT request: Make realtime_input_config and image encoding options configurable in push_video method
issues.body:
Currently, when using the push_video method, the image encoding options are hardcoded with DEFAULT_ENCODE_OPTIONS and there's no way to customize the realtime_input_config when sending video frames. This seems to have been removed in the v1 agents sdk. But is a feature that used to be there in v0. (Not sure why this was removed)


Additionally, Now that gemini live supports the ability to configure their automatic VAD [gemini doc](https://ai.google.dev/gemini-api/docs/live#configure-automatic-vad), can we have this also configurable while setting up the LiveConnectConfig class supports realtime_input_config parameter, it's not exposed in the current implementation of _build_connect_config().

Suggested Implementation:

- Update the push_video method to accept optional encoding parameters:

`   def push_video(self, frame: rtc.VideoFrame, encoding_options: Optional[Dict] = None) -> None:
       options = encoding_options or DEFAULT_ENCODE_OPTIONS
       encoded_data = images.encode(frame, options)
       # rest of the method`

- Update the RealtimeModel constructor to accept the realtime_input_config parameter 

`   def __init__(
       self,
       *,
       # existing parameters...
       realtime_input_config: NotGivenOr[RealtimeInputConfig] = NOT_GIVEN,
   ) -> None:
       # Store in options
       self._opts.realtime_input_config = realtime_input_config`


This enhancement provides greater flexibility by allowing:
- Configuration of realtime input behavior at model creation time 
- Per-frame customization of video encoding quality and parameters
- Better control over bandwidth usage and performance in resource-constrained environments

issues.title: Best practice to avoid missing first words after start_turn() with push-to-talk
issues.body:
Hi LiveKit team, thank you again for your amazing work on livekit-agents!

[We had previously discussed an issue with audio buffer synchronization](https://github.com/livekit/agents/issues/2040#issuecomment-2832791190) when using the `push_to_talk.md` example â€” especially around quick start/cancel/end_turn sequences where STT final transcripts would leak into the next turn.

Now weâ€™re encountering another closely related issue:

### Problem

When the client calls `start_turn()` and the user immediately begins speaking, the very beginning of their speech often gets cut off.
For example, if a user says **â€œHow are you today?â€** right after starting the turn, the transcript might only catch **â€œyou todayâ€.**

### What we tried
- We understand this might be related to a delay in setting up the STT stream.
- We attempted to inject silent frames (e.g., 300ms worth) at the beginning of a turn to â€œwarm upâ€ the STT pipeline â€” by either yielding silent AudioFrames in `stt_node()` or calling `stream.push_frame()` manually.
- However, these approaches didnâ€™t seem to solve the problem reliably. Sometimes they cause other side effects (e.g., sample rate mismatch errors) and generally feel hacky.

### Questions
- Is there a recommended way to prepare the STT pipeline so that the userâ€™s speech is captured immediately after `start_turn()`?
- Would it be better to open the STT stream earlier, such as right after the agent finishes speaking (before the user even calls start_turn)?
- Is there any best practice on handling this **â€œmissing first wordâ€ problem** when using push_to_talk-style interaction?

We couldnâ€™t find much documentation or examples related to this specific timing issue, so weâ€™d really appreciate any insights, or any workarounds that you suggest.

Thanks again for your support and for the fantastic work on LiveKit Agents! ðŸ™
issues.author: well-balanced

comments.author: longcw
comments.body:
probably you can call the `session.clear_user_turn()` after user turn committed instead of at the start of user turn? so that the STT stream is already ready for the new input audio.

We may also support the client sending a short audio clip before the turn starts, so that the agent will push that a

comments.body:
Hi @well-balanced, I was trying to reproduce the issue but I didn't see a significant transcription missing at the start. Did you mute the microphone when turn ended? 

Also we are trying to improve the stt flushing for the end of turn in https://github.com/livekit/agents/pull/2147, as shown in the

issues.title: Serverless Agents
issues.body:
Is there a way to run agents in a serverless environment?

I recently implemented agents using Twilio and WebSocket by leveraging the new WebSocket capabilities of Supabase (https://supabase.com/docs/guides/functions/websockets). The setup is straightforward: Twilio sends a request to Supabase, which keeps the agents alive as long as the WebSocket connection remains open.

I was expecting similar behavior with LiveKit but havenâ€™t found a way to achieve this so far. Is it possible to replicate this behavior with LiveKit, or am I required to maintain a long-lived server for my agents?

issues.title: Event `function_tools_executed` called multiple times instead of once with OpenAI Realtime API
issues.body:
Hey! Thanks for building such a great framework!

The `function_tools_executed` events does not work the same way for OpenAI Realtime API and the STT-LMM-TTS approach.

STT-LLM-TTS: `function_tools_executed` is called once, and contains all the function calls that happened
Realtime API: `function_tools_executed` is called multiple times (once for every function call), and only contains the respective results.

Example code to reproduce:

```python
from dataclasses import dataclass

from dotenv import load_dotenv
from livekit import agents
from livekit.agents import (
    Agent,
    AgentSession,
    RoomInputOptions,
    RunContext,
    ToolError,
    function_tool,
)
from livekit.agents.voice import FunctionToolsExecutedEvent
from livekit.plugins import cartesia, deepgram, noise_cancellation, openai, silero

load_dotenv()


@dataclass
class MySessionInfo:
    user_name: str | None = None
    zip_code: str | None = None


class RPCAssistant(Agent):
    def __init__(self) -> None:
        super().__init__(
            instructions="""You are a helpful voice AI assistant with the goal to collect the users name and zip code.
            Always follow all 'instructions' given in tool call results in your next response.""",
        )

    @function_tool()
    async def store_user_name(
        self,
        context: RunContext,
        user_name: str,
    ):
        """Store user name. Always update with the latest user name you got from the user.

        Args:
            user_name: The user name to store.
        """
        context.userdata.user_name = user_name

        return {
            "user_name": user_name,
            "instructions": "Repeat the name you understood to the user by spelling the letters one by one.",
        }

    @function_tool()
    async def update_user_zip_code(
        self,
        context: RunContext,
        zip_code: str,
    ):
        """Store user zip code. Always update with the latest zip code you got from the user.

        Args:
            zip_code: The zip code to store.
        """

        if len(zip_code) != 5:
            raise ToolError("Zip code must be 5 digits long.")

        context.userdata.zip_code = zip_code
        return {
            "zip_code": zip_code,
            "instructions": "Repeat the zip code you understood to the user by spelling the numbers one by one.",
        }


async def entrypoint(ctx: agents.JobContext):
    await ctx.connect()

    session = AgentSession[MySessionInfo](
        # stt=deepgram.STT(),
        # llm=openai.LLM(model="gpt-4o-mini"),
        # tts=cartesia.TTS(),
        # vad=silero.VAD.load(),
        llm=openai.realtime.RealtimeModel(voice="coral"),
        userdata=MySessionInfo(),
    )

    @session.on("function_tools_executed")
    def function_tools_executed(event: FunctionToolsExecutedEvent):
        for call in event.function_calls:
            print(f"Function call {call.name}")

    await session.start(
        room=ctx.room,
        agent=RPCAssistant(),
        room_input_options=RoomInputOptions(
            # LiveKit Cloud enhanced noise cancellation
            # - If self-hosting, omit this parameter
            # - For telephony applications, use `BVCTelephony` for best results
            noise_cancellation=noise_cancellation.BVC(),
        ),
    )

    await session.generate_reply(instructions="Greet the user and ask for their name.")


if __name__ == "__main__":
    agents.cli.run_app(agents.WorkerOptions(entrypoint_fnc=entrypoint))

```

Example logs for STT-LLM-TTS:

```
2025-05-07 18:09:21,853 - DEBUG livekit.agents - executing tool {"function": "store_user_name", "arguments": "{\"user_name\": \"Michael\"}", "speech_id": "speech_2b79ea306759", "pid": 79667, "job_id": "AJ_PascE9AQQkJz"}
2025-05-07 18:09:21,857 - DEBUG livekit.agents - executing tool {"function": "update_user_zip_code", "arguments": "{\"zip_code\": \"45678\"}", "speech_id": "speech_2b79ea306759", "pid": 79667, "job_id": "AJ_PascE9AQQkJz"}
2025-05-07 18:09:21,858 - DEBUG livekit.agents - tools execution completed {"speech_id": "speech_2b79ea306759", "pid": 79667, "job_id": "AJ_PascE9AQQkJz"}
Function call store_user_name
Function call update_user_zip_code
```

Example logs for Realtime: 

```
2025-05-07 18:11:39,984 - DEBUG livekit.agents - executing tool {"function": "store_user_name", "arguments": "{\"user_name\":\"Michael\"}", "speech_id": "speech_da3e721bc9a0", "pid": 81208, "job_id": "AJ_9wLVzLudj77Q"}
2025-05-07 18:11:39,994 - DEBUG livekit.agents - tools execution completed {"speech_id": "speech_da3e721bc9a0", "pid": 81208, "job_id": "AJ_9wLVzLudj77Q"}
Function call store_user_name
2025-05-07 18:11:43,719 - DEBUG livekit.agents - executing tool {"function": "update_user_zip_code", "arguments": "{\"zip_code\":\"56788\"}", "speech_id": "speech_1441ce9f1544", "pid": 81208, "job_id": "AJ_9wLVzLudj77Q"}
2025-05-07 18:11:43,723 - DEBUG livekit.agents - tools execution completed {"speech_id": "speech_1441ce9f1544", "pid": 81208, "job_id": "AJ_9wLVzLudj77Q"}

issues.title: AttributeError: 'Room' object has no attribute '_ffi_handle'
issues.body:
Hi,

I'm currently building an agent app using livekit==0.19.1 and encountering the following warning during runtime:

AttributeError: 'Room' object has no attribute '_ffi_handle'
at .__del__ ( /usr/local/lib/python3.10/asyncio/base_events.py:687 )

<function Room.__del__ at 0x7d9647d432e0>:
at .__del__ ( /home/appuser/.local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/livekit/rtc/room.py:142 )

This warning does not appear to affect the app's functionality, but I wanted to raise it in case it points to a deeper issue, such as improper cleanup or memory handling in the Room object.

â„¹ï¸ Note: I understand LiveKit has moved to version 1.x, but due to compatibility requirements I still need to keep using version 0.x at the moment.

Here is the relevant environment:

livekit==0.19.1
livekit-agents==0.12.18
livekit-plugins-openai==0.11.2
livekit-plugins-google==0.11.2
livekit-plugins-silero==0.7.3

Thanks in advance for your support!
issues.author: watthsup

issues.title: Gemini Realtime API Voice Breaks Mid-Speech with LiveKit Agents via Vertex AI
issues.body:
```
model = google.realtime.RealtimeModel(
            model="gemini-2.0-flash-exp",
            instructions=instructions,
            modalities=cast(list[Modality], config.modalities),
            voice=config.voice,
            temperature=config.temperature,
            max_output_tokens=int(config.max_response_output_tokens),
            api_key=config.gemini_api_key,
            api_version="v1beta1",
            vertexai=True,
            project=config.gemini_project_id,
            location=GEMINI_REGIONS[
                self._reconnect_attempts
            ],  # Trying to load balance between regions while reconnecting.
            enable_user_audio_transcription=False,
            enable_agent_audio_transcription=False,
        )
```


When using a multimodal voice agent configured with LiveKit Agents and the livekit-plugins-google plugin (using the configuration shown above) to interact with the Gemini Live API (real-time model) hosted on Vertex AI, the synthesized voice output from the agent frequently breaks or cuts off abruptly mid-speech. The audio playback starts correctly but stops before the intended sentence or response is fully delivered.


Environment:
- LiveKit Agents: livekit-agents[codecs,images]>=0.11.0,<0.13.0 (Please specify the exact version used if known, e.g., 0.12.18)
- LiveKit Google Plugin: livekit-plugins-google==0.11.2
- LiveKit Core: livekit==0.21.3
- LiveKit API: livekit-api==0.8.2
- AI Service: Google Gemini Live API (Realtime Model, e.g., gemini-2.0-flash-exp) via Vertex AI
issues.author: Denin-Siby

issues.title: Transcription output is not being truncated when interrupting agent speech with OpenAI Realtime API
issues.body:
Hey, it seems like there is an issue with the `conversation_item_added` event when trying to use it with the OpenAI Realtime API. As far as I understood from the docs, if the agent speech is interrupted, the transcription will be truncated so it does not include words which have not been spoken yet. However, it appears that this doesn't happen when using the OpenAI Realtime API as the `on_conversation_item_added` event returns text which was never spoken by the agent due to an interruption. This appears to happen even when using Livekits VAD and TurnDetection Model.

Version: `1.0.13`

Basic Example:

```
sync def entrypoint(ctx: JobContext):
    await ctx.connect(auto_subscribe=AutoSubscribe.AUDIO_ONLY)
    participant = await ctx.wait_for_participant(

    prompt = f"""
    "Begin the conversation and converse in German." 
    """

    session = AgentSession(
        allow_interruptions=True,
        llm=openai.realtime.RealtimeModel.with_azure(
            api_version="2024-10-01-preview",
            azure_endpoint=os.getenv("AZURE_OPENAI_URL"),
            api_key=os.getenv("AZURE_OPENAI_API_KEY"),
            azure_deployment="gpt-4o-realtime-preview",
            voice=instructions.personaData.speechModel or "alloy",
        ),
    )

    transcript: list[TranscriptMessage] = []
    start_timestamp = datetime.now()
    start_time = timedelta(seconds=0)

    @session.on("conversation_item_added")
    def on_conversation_item_added(event: ConversationItemAddedEvent):
        nonlocal start_time
        # to iterate over all types of content:
        transcript_content = ""
        for content in event.item.content:
            if isinstance(content, AudioContent):
                print("AudioContent")
            if isinstance(content, str):
                transcript_content += " " + content
        end_time = timedelta(seconds=(datetime.now() - start_timestamp).total_seconds())
        transcript.append(
            TranscriptMessage(
                role=event.item.role,
                content=transcript_content,
                start_time=start_time,
                end_time=end_time,
            )
        )
        start_time = end_time
        print(transcript)

    await session.start(
        room=ctx.room,
        agent=MyAgent(
            instructions=prompt,
            participant_id=participant.identity,
            room_name=ctx.room.name,
        ),
        room_input_options=RoomInputOptions(
            noise_cancellation=noise_cancellation.BVC(),
            sync_transcription=True,
        ),
    )

if __name__ == "__main__":
    cli.run_app(WorkerOptions(entrypoint_fnc=entrypoint))
```
issues.author: GigaDroid

comments.author: GigaDroid
comments.body: Appears to be fixed in 1.0.19

comments.author: codecurry
ChenghaoMou
comments.body: Can I ask how you were using transcription? There is new hook/event to track transcriptions see https://github.com/livekit/agents/issues/1979#issuecomment-2799553191

comments.author: longcw
comments.body: any reason you want to use the `transcription` module? Please check the latest doc of 1.0 in https://docs.livekit.io/agents/build/text/

comments.author: codecurry
comments.body: @longcw  @ChenghaoMou  @davidzhao  I am exploring if we can use livekit for media streaming over webRTC. We then want to use our own custom STT,TTS and LLM instead of using agent pipelines for Session with Agent instance?

comments.author: longcw
comments.body: tho not quite follow that is the use case for the original transcription module, it was refactored for the new agent io design in https://github.com/livekit/agents/blob/main/livekit-agents/livekit/agents/voice/transcription/synchronizer.py

livekit.agents._exceptions.APIConnectionError: failed to synthesize speech after 4 attempts

`


The code is
import os

from dotenv import load_dotenv

from livekit import agents
from livekit.agents import AgentSession, Agent, RoomInputOptions
from livekit.plugins import (
    noise_cancellation,
    silero,
)

from livekit.plugins import google
from livekit.plugins.turn_detector.multilingual import MultilingualModel

load_dotenv()


class Assistant(Agent):
    def __init__(self) -> None:
        super().__init__(instructions="You are a helpful voice AI assistant.")


async def entrypoint(ctx: agents.JobContext):
    await ctx.connect()
    print(os.getenv("GOOGLE_API_KEY"))
    session = AgentSession(
        stt=google.STT(
          model="medical_dictation",
          spoken_punctuation=True,
          sample_rate=16000,
          punctuate=True,
          languages="en-US",
          interim_results=True,
        ),
        llm=google.LLM(model="gemini-2.0-flash-exp", temperature=0.8),
        tts=google.TTS(
          language="en-US",
          gender="female",
          voice_name="en-US-Chirp3-HD-Leda",
          sample_rate=16000
        ),
        vad=silero.VAD.load(),
        turn_detection=MultilingualModel(),
    )
    await session.start(
        room=ctx.room,
        agent=Assistant(),
        room_input_options=RoomInputOptions(
            noise_cancellation=noise_cancellation.BVC(),
        ),
    )

    await session.generate_reply(
        instructions="Greet the user and offer your assistance.",
    )


if __name__ == "__main__":
    agents.cli.run_app(agents.WorkerOptions(entrypoint_fnc=entrypoint))


Please let me know what you need further.
Thanks for the support.

issues.title: [BUGS]: PlayHT Plugin: Wrong encoding calculation and sample rate being ignored
issues.body:
I get a `Value Error: Unknown format: wav` error when using defaults for the playht plugin.

```python
tts=playht.TTS()
```

I found the following line:

https://github.com/livekit/agents/blob/ff2b6605cb61f26f51a3d64024babd0e747123c2/livekit-plugins/livekit-plugins-playht/livekit/plugins/playht/tts.py#L163

`_encoding_from_format` expects an argument of type `TTSEncoding` whereas a `_TTSEncoding` arg is being passed. Both are different types and don't have any overlaps.

https://github.com/livekit/agents/blob/ff2b6605cb61f26f51a3d64024babd0e747123c2/livekit-plugins/livekit-plugins-playht/livekit/plugins/playht/tts.py#L58

https://github.com/livekit/agents/blob/ff2b6605cb61f26f51a3d64024babd0e747123c2/livekit-plugins/livekit-plugins-playht/livekit/plugins/playht/models.py#L5-L15


Above TTSEncoding values are also incorrect for PlayHT API and seem to be copied from elevenlab plugin. Also the sample rate provided in the top level config is never provided to the PlayHT api (in the json payload).

Is the plugin a Work In Progress? I think it should be removed from the README if it is.

issues.title: default value for function tool argument doesn't work for some types
issues.body:
Create an ticket to track this issue:

I was not able to create a tool with default argument like
```python
    @function_tool
    async def get_weather(self, location: str = "") -> str:
        """
        Called when the user asks about the weather.

        Args:
            location: The location to get the weather for
        """
```
OAI raises error Invalid schema for function 'get_weather': In context=('properties', 'location'), 'default' is not permitted.
```bash
2025-04-11 15:01:20,350 - WARNING livekit.agents - failed to generate LLM completion, retrying in 2.0s
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/longc/data/code/agents/livekit-agents/livekit/agents/llm/llm.py", line 137, in _main_task
    return await self._run()
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/home/longc/data/code/agents/livekit-plugins/livekit-plugins-openai/livekit/plugins/openai/llm.py", line 599, in _run
    raise APIStatusError(
livekit.agents._exceptions.APIStatusError: Error code: 400 - {'error': {'message': "Invalid schema for function 'get_weather': In context=('properties', 'location'), 'default' is not permitted.", 'type': 'invalid_request_error', 'param': 'tools[0].function.parameters', 'code': 'invalid_function_parameters'}} (status_code=400, request_id=req_6da84b4da8310ea5c55054fa50e9113e, body={'message': "Invalid schema for function 'get_weather': In context=('properties', 'location'), 'default' is not permitted.", 'type': 'invalid_request_error', 'param': 'tools[0].function.parameters', 'code': 'invalid_function_parameters'})
```

But something like this works, seems it has to be an enum to have the default value?
```python
    @function_tool
    async def toggle_light(
        self,
        switch_to: Literal["on", "off"] = "on",
    ) -> str:
        ...
```

their schemas are
```
# failed
{'properties': {'location': {'default': 'New York', 'description': 'The location to get the weather for', 'title': 'Location', 'type': 'string'}}, 'title': 'GetWeatherArgs', 'type': 'object', 'additionalProperties': False, 'required': ['location']}

# succ
{'properties': {'switch_to': {'default': 'on', 'description': 'The state to turn the light to', 'enum': ['on', 'off'], 'title': 'Switch To', 'type': 'string'}}, 'title': 'ToggleLightArgs', 'type': 'object', 'additionalProperties': False, 'required': ['switch_to']}
```
also, can we remove the arg from required if it has a default value?

issues.title: function tool arg default value cannot be None
issues.body:
### Issue 1: the default value of the arg of function tool cannot be `None`

```python
    @function_tool()
    async def update_caller_status(
        context: RunContext_T,
        caller_name: Optional[str] = None,
    ) -> str:
        logger.info(f"Updating caller status to {caller_name}")
        return "ok"

```
for example this one raises 
> livekit.agents._exceptions.APIStatusError: Error code: 400 - {'error': {'message': "Invalid schema for function 'update_caller_status': In context=('properties', 'caller_name'), 'default' is not permitted.", 'type': 'invalid_request_error', 'param': 'tools[0].function.parameters', 'code': 'invalid_function_parameters'}} (status_code=400, request_id=req_69d97bdefaaaa6f45cf652fbe439f4b1, body={'message': "Invalid schema for function 'update_caller_status': In context=('properties', 'caller_name'), 'default' is not permitted.", 'type': 'invalid_request_error', 'param': 'tools[0].function.parameters', 'code': 'invalid_function_parameters'})

the schema generated by `build_strict_openai_schema` is
```python
{'function': {'description': '',
              'name': 'update_caller_status',
              'parameters': {'additionalProperties': False,
                             'properties': {'caller_name': {'default': None,
                                                            'type': ['string',
                                                                     'null']}},
                             'required': ['caller_name'],
                             'type': 'object'},
              'strict': True},
 'type': 'function'}
```

A str default works for this case.

~### Issue 2: function_tool without `context: RunContext_T` has a wrong args scehma~
(it's bc the class method missing the `self`)

And this is my code:
`import os

from dotenv import load_dotenv

from livekit import agents
from livekit.agents import AgentSession, Agent, RoomInputOptions
from livekit.plugins import (
    noise_cancellation,
    silero,
)

from livekit.plugins import google
from livekit.plugins.turn_detector.multilingual import MultilingualModel

load_dotenv()


class Assistant(Agent):
    def __init__(self) -> None:
        super().__init__(instructions="You are a helpful voice AI assistant.")


async def entrypoint(ctx: agents.JobContext):
    await ctx.connect()
    print(os.getenv("GOOGLE_API_KEY"))
    session = AgentSession(
        stt=google.STT(
          model="medical_dictation",
          spoken_punctuation=True,
          sample_rate=16000,
          punctuate=True,
          languages="en-US",
          interim_results=True,
        ),
        llm=google.LLM(model="gemini-2.0-flash-exp", temperature=0.8),
        tts=google.TTS(
          language="en-US",
          gender="female",
          voice_name="en-US-Chirp3-HD-Leda",
          sample_rate=16000
        ),
        vad=silero.VAD.load(),
        turn_detection=MultilingualModel(),
    )
    await session.start(
        room=ctx.room,
        agent=Assistant(),
        room_input_options=RoomInputOptions(
            noise_cancellation=noise_cancellation.BVC(),
        ),
    )

    await session.generate_reply(
        instructions="Greet the user and offer your assistance.",
    )


if __name__ == "__main__":
    agents.cli.run_app(agents.WorkerOptions(entrypoint_fnc=entrypoint))`




Let me know what im doing wrong and if you need any more details or content.
issues.author: fahadanwaar

issues.title: SIP Participant fails to create when in agent context
issues.body:
Hello, I love what you guys are building but I am running into an issue with SIP that I am confused about. 
I am using this code as reference: https://github.com/livekit-examples/outbound-caller-python 
I managed to set up everything correctly because my trunk is working when I run `lk sip participant create sip_outbound.json` 

It correctly calls my number.  So as the readme suggest, I should be able to call myself with the agent in the room using:
```
lk dispatch create \
  --new-room \
  --agent-name outbound-caller \
  --metadata '{"phone_number": "my-number", "transfer_to": "other-number"}'
```

But I get this error
`2025-04-30 19:59:21,767 - ERROR outbound-caller - error creating SIP participant: twirp error unknown: object cannot be found, SIP status: None None {"pid": 90589, "job_id": "AJ_U65yEpH3VAjK"}`

How should I go to debug that?
Here are the input of my sip creation at this line:  https://github.com/livekit-examples/outbound-caller-python/blob/main/agent.py#L212
```
Room Name: my-sip-room
SIP Trunk ID: TKd3b5c07798d131b1e50f0c2cd724ffe3
SIP Call To: +33...
Participant Identity: +33...
Wait Until Answered: True
```
here are my dependencies in `pyproject.toml`
```
[project]
name = "outbound-caller-python"
version = "0.1.0"
requires-python = ">=3.13"
dependencies = [
    "livekit>=1.0",
    "livekit-agents[cartesia,deepgram,openai,silero,turn-detector]~=1.0rc0",
    "livekit-plugins-noise-cancellation~=0.2",
    "python-dotenv~=1.0",
]
```

I believe its related to https://github.com/livekit-examples/outbound-caller-python/issues/7
issues.author: pievalentin

comments.author: pievalentin
comments.body: It was an error on my part. I used the twilio trunkId instead of the livekit trunk id

issues.title: Gemini API WebSocket Connection Overload Issue
issues.body:
Issue Description:

- When running the gemini_agent.py example, the application is bombarding the Gemini API with WebSocket connection requests, resulting in extensible_stubs::OVERLOADED_TOO_MANY_RETRIES_PER_REQUEST errors. This causes service degradation and eventually failures.

Details:

- The multimodal agent appears to be making multiple API calls in rapid succession without proper rate limiting:
- Each interaction triggers new API calls without respecting rate limits
- Multiple WebSocket connections are being attempted simultaneously
- Log shows repeated "AFC is enabled with max remote calls: 10" messages followed by overload errors

Steps to Reproduce:

- Run the gemini_agent.py example
- Interact with the agent through voice
- Observe terminal logs showing repeated connection attempts and eventual API overload errors

issues.title: Issue with api.S3Upload when integrating with Supabase
issues.body:
Running the following code snippet, livekit api is not properly reading access key and I get: "the request signature we calculated does not match the signature you provided." 

The access key and the secret work perfectly, and the recording is being initialized correctly. Seems to me that S3Upload function is not properly taking in secret key.


 # Create the recording request
        req = api.RoomCompositeEgressRequest(
            room_name=room_name,
            audio_only=False,
            file_outputs=[api.EncodedFileOutput(
                file_type=api.EncodedFileType.MP4,
                filepath=filepath,
                # Supabase storage integration
                s3=api.S3Upload(
                    bucket=bucket_name,
                    region="auto",  # us-east-1
                    access_key=supabase_access_key,  
                    secret=supabase_secret_key, 
                    endpoint=end_point,
                    force_path_style=True,
                ),
            )],
        )
issues.author: JslYoon

comments.author: davidzhao
comments.body:
the issue is on the Supabase side: https://github.com/supabase/storage/issues/577

they are currently not compatible with AWS Go SDK v2. Since v1 has been deprecated, we don't have much of a choice on our side

issues.title: livekit cloud: the room connection was not established within 10 seconds after calling job_entry.
issues.body:
Hello LiveKit team,

We are getting this issue from time to time: 

```
The room connection was not established within 10 seconds after calling job_entry. This may indicate that job_ctx.connect() was not called.
```

We notice that sometimes the `context.connect()` task can take minutes (after multiple retries) disturbing our LiveKit calls, as the participant won't wait for minutes to start a call.

The interesting thing is that 2 different sessions are created for the same room:

- Session 1 ([RM_8yqeew7Bcxeh](https://cloud.livekit.io/projects/p_32w6jn5wyzd/sessions/RM_8yqeew7Bcxeh)) when the participant joins but is awaiting for the `context.connect()` to finish. Client will leave after 30 secs as there are no response.

- Session 2 ([RM_qBxLxGPPP6uP](https://cloud.livekit.io/projects/p_32w6jn5wyzd/sessions/RM_qBxLxGPPP6uP)) when the agent joins after the `context.connect()` finished (after many retries). Room will be closed later as there are no participants.

Please, is there a way to avoid this ? can Region pinning help on this ?

Thank you!
issues.author: devniel

ARG PYTHON_VERSION=3.12.9
FROM python:${PYTHON_VERSION}-slim as base

# Prevents Python from writing pyc files.
ENV PYTHONDONTWRITEBYTECODE=1

# Keeps Python from buffering stdout and stderr to avoid situations where
# the application crashes without emitting any logs due to buffering.
ENV PYTHONUNBUFFERED=1

WORKDIR /app

# Create a non-privileged user that the app will run under.
ARG UID=10001
RUN adduser \
    --disabled-password \
    --gecos "" \
    --home "/nonexistent" \
    --shell "/sbin/nologin" \
    --no-create-home \
    --uid "${UID}" \
    appuser

# âœ… Copy only requirements.txt first (allows better Docker caching)
COPY requirements.txt .

# âœ… Install dependencies
RUN python -m pip install --no-cache-dir -r requirements.txt

# âœ… Now copy the rest of the application source code
COPY . .

# Switch to the non-privileged user to run the application.
USER appuser

# Run the application.
CMD ["sh", "-c", "python agent_bab.py download-files && python agent_bab.py start"]
```

<!--
Hello! Thanks for taking the time to file a bug report.

Before creating this issue, we kindly ask that you use the search functionality
to see if anyone else has already reported this issue.
Please include details such as environment, package versions, minimal examples,
and error logs, if applicable.

When running in console mode, calling ctx.delete_room() triggers a TypeError because room.name is returning a MagicMock object instead of a string value.

issues.title: Inconsistent transcript buffer behavior with start_turn / cancel_turn / end_turn flow (push-to-talk example)
issues.body:
First of all, thank you for the amazing work on livekit-agents â€” weâ€™ve been building a new product using it and have found the project incredibly useful and thoughtfully designed.

Weâ€™re currently using the `push_to_talk.md` example as the basis for our client integration. However, weâ€™re encountering an issue with synchronizing the audio buffer across `start_turn`, `cancel_turn`, and `end_turn`. In particular, when users interact quickly (e.g., speaking immediately and cancelling early), the buffer state seems to get into an inconsistent state, which leads to unexpected transcripts being sent to the LLM.

## Example scenario
Hereâ€™s a simplified flow that demonstrates the issue:

1. `start_turn()` is called
2. User begins speaking: **â€œHow are you today?â€**
3. `cancel_turn()` is called immediately (this calls `session.clear_user_turn()` internally)
4. In the logs, we see:
```sh
livekit.agents - received user transcript {"user_transcript": "How are.", ...}
```
5. `start_turn()` is called again (again calls `session.clear_user_turn()`)
6. User says: **â€œMy name is Wynnâ€**
7. `end_turn()` is called
8. In `on_user_turn_completed` method, the new_message is: **"you today my"**

So despite clearing the user turn twice, the transcript still contains parts of the previous utterance. This seems to happen especially when STT final transcripts arrive slightly after the cancel, leading to fragments from earlier input leaking into the final turn.


### Additional questions
Is there a best practice for handling this kind of flow?
Weâ€™d love to hear how others are dealing with this â€” whether thereâ€™s a canonical way to fully flush/reset the STT buffer or if additional manual logic is recommended on the app side.

Thanks again for the fantastic work on the agents â€” we really appreciate it :)
issues.author: well-balanced

comments.author: longcw
comments.body:
Yeah I noticed this as well, if the user turn closed too fast right after the end of user speech, the STT may not return the final user transcription, causing two issues: 1) the transcription of this turn is not completed, 2) the rest text may be added to the next turn.

Basically these [two methods

comments.author: well-balanced
comments.body: So for now, is adding a short await `asyncio.sleep(...)` after `end_turn` the best workaround to make sure STT has enough time to flush? Just wanna make sure Iâ€™m not missing a better way.

comments.author: longcw
comments.body: @well-balanced yeah please give it a try, add a small delay before disable the input audio (so STT gets the silent audio frame to indicate the user speech done) and end turn. I'll also investigate if there is a better solution.

comments.author: longcw
comments.body: Btw this works better for OAI realtime model which has the explicit `commit_audio` and `clear_audio`.

comments.author: well-balanced
comments.body: Thanks so much for the quick and thoughtful reply. Iâ€™ll try adding the small delay like you suggested and see how it goes. I might come back with more questions if I run into anything else.

issues.title: AgentSession's generate_reply method isn't flexible enough for outbound calls
issues.body:
In an outbound call, we need the agent to initiate the conversation with someone by following a specific system prompt. 

Currently, AgentSession's generate_reply method does not enable the user to pass in a `llm.ChatMessage`, which would allow us to set this system message. The method takes in a string that's wrapped in a user message.

Additionally, the instructions parameter in generate_reply ends up overwriting the Agent's initial instructions through a `AgentActivity#_pipeline_reply_task` call to `update_instructions`. If we could provide temporary instructions to `generate_reply`, that would solve our issue as well. 

This is the method that I'm currently using to wrap `Agent#generate_reply`:

```python
    async def generate_reply(self, instructions: str):
        msg = ChatMessage(
            role="system",
            content=[instructions],
        )

        await self.agent_session.interrupt()
        resp = await self._activity.generate_reply(
            user_message=msg,
        )

        return resp
```
issues.author: DavidHuie

The use cases are slightly different in that I want to be able to customize the exact generate_replay environment. Then there's also the issue

it does not *replace* the agent's instructions.. it would only do so for this turn, but does not cause side effects otherwise

issues.title: OpenAI Realtime API audio cuts off intermittently before finishing playback
issues.body:
We observe that occasionally (once or many times in a 20 minute interval) when the OpenAI Realtime API in livekit responds with a long audio message, the audio cuts out before playback completes (but the transcript is complete). There is no interruption from VAD and we have seen this issue does NOT occur in OpenAI official playground (https://platform.openai.com/playground/realtime) suggesting it is a bug in LiveKit framework.


**Reproducibility**

We can reproduce this issue with new livekit agents v1 and 0.12.18. We provide minimal examples based on the official templates 

https://github.com/moz164164/test_livekit_v1
https://github.com/scoville/voc-livekit-multimodal-example/tree/main

- To reproduce, ask the model to produce verbose responses and talk to it for at least 20 minutes, and always see this behaviour at least once, sometimes many times
- We find the same behaviour with livekit whether we use OpenAI provider in livekit, or the Azure flavour of the Realtime API in livekit
- Importantly we do not observe this behaviour directly when using https://platform.openai.com/playground/realtime suggesting that is a bug in the event handling client side
- We do not see anything unusual in the logs like errors or warning when this occurs, and we do not see any interrupt: True in the logs, so it is not a VAD issue.

- Video of the issue can be found [here](https://livekit-users.slack.com/archives/C07FY8WHGPM/p1744342624375929?thread_ts=1744100031.837599&cid=C07FY8WHGPM) on relevant slack thread in LiveKit Slack community at  9 mins 42 seconds 

Another user has reported the same issue here: https://livekit-users.slack.com/archives/C0816MD6LCR/p1742425382392459


**Potential Explanation**

- We have searched for similar reports, and maybe the most promising lead we have found so far as to a possible explanation is here: https://community.openai.com/t/sharing-experiences-about-realtime-in-the-backend/1107471

> After you finish speaking, you send a response.create request, then the AI â€‹â€‹sends audio fragments via several response.audio.delta events and sends a response.audio.done event when it finishes. You then play each audio delta and stop the speakers when a finished audio arrives. Because handling audio deltas takes longer, it is necessary to give a small delay before stopping the speakers. This solved the problem I was experiencing.

Could it be in the current livekit code that the client code prematurely sends a response.audio.done before we have guaranteed all response.audio.delta have been played out the speakers to the user?

i.e. in that post they suggest

```
        // Event handler for the end of an audio response
        realtime.onEvent(ServerEvent.ResponseAudioDone.class, event -> {
            delay(1000); // Short delay to ensure all audio is received
            sound.speaker.stop(); // Stop playback
            sound.speaker.drain(); // Flush any remaining audio
        });
```
I would be grateful if you could ask a member of the dev team familiar with the livekit openai realtime API client to review this and see if that may be the bug that is occurring here :bow:
issues.author: bml1g12

* https://livekit-users.slack.com/archives/C0816MD6LCR/p1742425382392459

issues.title: TTS response_format PCM is not working
issues.body:
I am using livekit 1.0.13 with OpenAI TTS.
I hosted my own Kokoro-TTS and used it with OpenAI TTS like below,

```
 tts=openai.TTS(
            base_url="http://localhost:8880/v1",
            model="kokoro",
            voice="af_sky",
            response_format="pcm",
            speed=1.1,
        ),
```

I am facing an issue when using `pcm` response_format; other `wav` and `mp3` are working fine. 
By investigating, I found an issue in  `AudioStreamDecoder's _decode_loop` method. It used `av` and as pcm is raw format, its throwing error like  `Invalid data found when processing input: `

issues.title: Possible regression: duplicated full assistant transcript in Chat Context when interrupted
issues.body: This is likely a regression in `livekit-agents` >= 1.0.14 The following is printed at the beginning of the chat function: ```python for item in chat_ctx.items: if item.role not in ("user", "assistant"): continue print(item) ``` Observing duplicated messages ``` id='item_bac397280e97' type='message' role='user' content=['testing testing can you hear me'] interrupted=False hash=None id='item_21dc18363f0e' type='message' role='assistant' content=['Yeah, I hear you.\n'] interrupted=False hash=None id='item_c09f76f76643' type='message' role='user' content=['is a test this is a test testing testing'] interrupted=False hash=None id='item_8158d506832f' type='message' role='user' content=['this is a test this is a test this is another test'] interrupted=False hash=None id='item_9ce2e74f19a3' type='message' role='assistant' content=['Yeah, I hear you.\n'] interrupted=True hash=None id='item_bf99e3cebaa4' type='message' role='assistant' content=['Yeah, I hear you.\n'] interrupted=True hash=None id='item_e1bec513f23d' type='message' role='user' content=['can you hear me can you hear me'] interrupted=False hash=None id='item_7d94e6d0e23e' type='message' role='assistant' content=['Yeah, I hear you.\n'] interrupted=True hash=None id='item_f1088dd35cd7' type='message' role='user' content=['testing testing can you hear me'] interrupted=False hash=None ``` It is repeating the last successful message `Yeah, I hear you` but I was expecting either: 1. empty because of interruption 2. something that's uniquely generated for that interaction even if interruption or sync fails Downgrading `livekit-agents` to <1.0.14 seems to solve the issue: ``` id='item_f5629ea89c1b' type='message' role='user' content=['testing testing can you hear me'] interrupted=False hash=None id='item_81fc2432050a' type='message' role='assistant' content=['Yeah, I can hear you.\n'] interrupted=False hash=None id='item_43e59fe8c920' type='message' role='user' content=['testing testing one two three four five'] interrupted=False hash=None id='item_fbc24237468e' type='message' role='assistant' content=[''] interrupted=True hash=None id='item_c88f7072795a' type='message' role='user' content=['this is a test can you hear me'] interrupted=False hash=None id='item_dbf83a08b626' type='message' role='assistant' content=[''] interrupted=True hash=None id='item_a154c1a84d77' type='message' role='user' content=['how about now one two three four five testing testing'] interrupted=False hash=None id='item_305a1a641981' type='message' role='assistant' content=[''] interrupted=True hash=None id='item_89c6b5e46be3' type='message' role='user' content=['this is a test'] interrupted=False hash=None ```

issues.title: Turn detection in Gemini Realtime not working
issues.body:
Hi all, I'm using Gemini Realtime to build my agent. I'm noticing that my agent is not able to do turn_detection, and it's just interrupting me making it inefficient.
I'm using the new RealtimeModel here; https://github.com/livekit/agents/blob/main/livekit-plugins/livekit-plugins-google/livekit/plugins/google/beta/realtime/realtime_api.py


```
import os
import yaml
import logging
from pathlib import Path
from dotenv import load_dotenv
from livekit import api
from livekit.agents import JobContext, WorkerOptions, cli
from livekit.agents.llm import function_tool
from livekit.agents.voice import Agent, AgentSession, RunContext
from livekit.plugins import (
    noise_cancellation
    )
from livekit.plugins.google.beta.realtime.realtime_api import RealtimeModel

logger = logging.getLogger("function-calling")
logger.setLevel(logging.INFO)


load_dotenv()

class FunctionAgent(Agent):
    def __init__(self) -> None:
        super().__init__(
            instructions="""
                You are a helpful assistant communicating through voice.
                Note: If asked to print to the console, use the `print_to_console` function.
            """,
            llm=RealtimeModel(
            model= "gemini-2.0-flash-exp",
            voice="Puck",
            temperature=0.8,
            ),
        )

    @function_tool
    async def print_to_console(self, context: RunContext):
        print("Console Print Success!")
        return None, "I've printed to the console."

    async def on_enter(self):
        self.session.generate_reply()

async def entrypoint(ctx: JobContext):
    await ctx.connect()
    session = AgentSession()
    await session.start(
        agent=FunctionAgent(),
        room=ctx.room
    )

if __name__ == "__main__":
    cli.run_app(WorkerOptions(entrypoint_fnc=entrypoint,))
```

When I run the agent and test in the playground, I see the agent just interrupting me before I have finished my thought which is not good. Please help me implement turn_Detection in Gemini Realtime @jayeshp19
issues.author: Kamal-Moha

comments.author: khantseithu
comments.body: Having the same issue, with gemini realtime model, it works fine when I was in livekit 0.x version. Recently upgraded to v1 latest, turn detection for gemini realtime is completely broken. OpenAI realtime works fine for turn detection in v1.

issues.title: Running agents with connect --room causes worker to receive sometimes two job requests instead of one
issues.body:
Hello! I am running simple livekit worker with command `python main.py connect --room tpapaj-room` (where `tpapaj-room` can be anything) using function
```
from livekit.agents import AutoSubscribe, JobContext, WorkerOptions, cli, llm
(...)
    cli.run_app(WorkerOptions(entrypoint_fnc=entrypoint))
```
where `entrypoint` is my function where I create `VoiceAssistant` etc.

Sometimes it works correctly and one job request is received:
```
2024-11-09 17:33:47,917 - INFO livekit.agents - starting worker {"version": "0.10.1", "rtc-version": "0.18.0"}
2024-11-09 17:33:48,258 - INFO livekit.agents - registered worker {"id": "AW_xxxWY4", "region": "Germany", "protocol": 15, "node_id": "NC_xxxF3R"}
2024-11-09 17:33:48,259 - INFO livekit.agents - connecting to room tpapaj-room 
2024-11-09 17:33:48,526 - INFO livekit.agents - received job request {"job_id": "AJ_xxxiSW", "dispatch_id": "", "room_name": "tpapaj-room", "agent_name": "", "resuming": false}
```

Sometimes on startup worker receives two job requests:
```
2024-11-09 17:34:15,144 - INFO livekit.agents - starting worker {"version": "0.10.1", "rtc-version": "0.18.0"}
2024-11-09 17:34:15,505 - INFO livekit.agents - registered worker {"id": "AW_yxxxWiS", "region": "Germany", "protocol": 15, "node_id": "NC_xxx39j"}
2024-11-09 17:34:15,507 - INFO livekit.agents - connecting to room tpapaj-room 
2024-11-09 17:34:16,473 - INFO livekit.agents - received job request {"job_id": "AJ_xxxvAt", "dispatch_id": "", "room_name": "tpapaj-room", "agent_name": "", "resuming": false}
2024-11-09 17:34:16,581 - INFO livekit.agents - received job request {"job_id": "AJ_xxxPpE", "dispatch_id": "", "room_name": "tpapaj-room", "agent_name": "", "resuming": false}
```
This causes application to create two agents(entrypoint function is called twice) who then start talk to each other in a room. As you can see, received job requests have different ids(I masked parts of ids with `xxx` strings, just in case).
It looks like it has tendency to create two agents when `--room` argument uses a room name that was not used for a while and restarting the worker with the same room usually works correctly and creates a single agent.

I expected to see just one job request being sent to the worker.

It seems to be similar issue to https://github.com/livekit/agents/issues/759 but it is claimed there that the problem was fixed, but I still see the problem.
I tried livekit-agent versions 0.10.1, 0.10.2, 0.11.1 without success.

Current livekit packages in `pip freeze`:
```
livekit==0.18.0
livekit-agents==0.11.1
livekit-api==0.7.1
livekit-plugins-elevenlabs==0.7.7
livekit-plugins-openai==0.10.5
livekit-plugins-silero==0.7.3
livekit-protocol==0.6.0
```
issues.author: tpapaj

comments.author: ChenghaoMou
comments.body:
Also seeing the same issue.

A workaround I found: filter requests with a custom `request_fnc`

```python
seen = set()
async def request_fnc(req: JobRequest):
    if req.room.name != room_id or req.room.name in seen:
        await req.reject()
        return
    seen.add(req.room.name)

comments.author: keenborder786
comments.body: I am also facing the same bug, where for some reason when we perform explicit agent dispatch using `create_dispatch`, the running Worker starts two agent processes.

comments.author: socrait-cameron
comments.body: FYI, we've also seen this one. We coded around it with an in-memory cache of job request id's similar to ChenghaoMou's solution above.

issues.title: Multilingual Agent (STT and TTS); is that possible with LiveKit?
issues.body:
Hi,

I recently started using LiveKit for building an Agent, so far I have been able to make it work with a simple RAG Example.

```
    stt_google = google.STT(
        languages=["nl-NL", "en-US"],
        detect_language=True, interim_results=True)

    stt_openai = openai.STT(detect_language=True)
    language = stt_openai.

    tts = google.TTS(language="nl-NL", voice_name="nl-NL-Standard-C")

    agent = VoicePipelineAgent(
        vad=ctx.proc.userdata["vad"],
        stt=stt_openai,
        llm=openai.LLM(model="gpt-4o-mini"),
        tts=tts,
        chat_ctx=initial_ctx,
        turn_detector=turn_detector.EOUModel(),
        will_synthesize_assistant_reply=will_synthesize_assistant_reply_rag,
    )
```

The scenario I am looking to implement is as follows (either using Google Speech or OpenAI Whisper): the user talks in a number of languages, English, Dutch, French, Spanish etc. Based on this I want to be able to get (detect) the spoken language by the user and set the language spoken by the Agent. Have been going through Slack and documentation, but am unable to find out how to best do this.

Any pointers or tips and experiences are welcome. Thanks in adance.

issues.title: Agent cannot hear participant for Outbound SIP call in 1.0
issues.body:
Hi, thanks for all the work for 1.0, the new APIs are great. I am noticing a bug that's preventing us from upgrading though.

For some reason when we do an outbound SIP call from our agent, the call itself works fine, my phone rings and I can pick it up, but then the agent never hears anything for this participant.

Interestingly, if I make some change causing an agent reload, it hangs up the call and then calls me again, and in that second call everything works perfectly normally. But consistently if I just start up the agent and then dispatch it, it cannot hear me. 

I am able to recreate this with the [outbound calling example](https://github.com/livekit-examples/outbound-caller-python/blob/main/agent.py). I stripped it down to just the most basic possible, and the issue still occurs with this agent on 1.0.15:

```python
from __future__ import annotations

import asyncio
import logging

from livekit import api
from livekit.agents import (
    Agent,
    AgentSession,
    JobContext,
    WorkerOptions,
    cli,
)
from livekit.plugins import (
    cartesia,
    deepgram,
    openai,
    silero,
)

logger = logging.getLogger("outbound-caller")
logger.setLevel(logging.INFO)

outbound_trunk_id = "<my trunk id>"
phone = "<my phone number>"


class OutboundCaller(Agent):
    def __init__(
        self,
        *,
        name: str,
        appointment_time: str,
    ):
        super().__init__(
            instructions=f"""
            You are a scheduling assistant for a dental practice. Your interface with user will be voice.
            You will be on a call with a patient who has an upcoming appointment. Your goal is to confirm the appointment details.
            As a customer service representative, you will be polite and professional at all times. Allow user to end the conversation.

            When the user would like to be transferred to a human agent, first confirm with them. upon confirmation, use the transfer_call tool.
            The customer's name is {name}. His appointment is on {appointment_time}.
            """
        )


async def entrypoint(ctx: JobContext):
    logger.info(f"connecting to room {ctx.room.name}")
    await ctx.connect()

    agent = OutboundCaller(
        name="Jayden",
        appointment_time="next Tuesday at 3pm",
    )

    session = AgentSession(
        vad=silero.VAD.load(),
        stt=deepgram.STT(),
        tts=cartesia.TTS(),
        llm=openai.LLM(model="gpt-4o"),
    )

    asyncio.create_task(
        session.start(
            agent=agent,
            room=ctx.room,
        )
    )

    try:
        await ctx.api.sip.create_sip_participant(
            api.CreateSIPParticipantRequest(
                room_name=ctx.room.name,
                sip_trunk_id=outbound_trunk_id,
                sip_call_to=phone,
                participant_identity=phone,
            )
        )

        await ctx.wait_for_participant(identity=phone)

    except api.TwirpError as e:
        logger.error(
            f"error creating SIP participant: {e.message}, "
            + f"SIP status: {e.metadata.get('sip_status_code')} "
            + f"{e.metadata.get('sip_status')}"
        )
        ctx.shutdown()


if __name__ == "__main__":
    cli.run_app(
        WorkerOptions(
            entrypoint_fnc=entrypoint,
            agent_name="outbound-caller",
        )
    )
```

issues.title: Websocket Connection Concurrency Limit
issues.body:
Here is what I am observing:

In our dev environment, even when there is only one concurrent LK session, we are observing 429 from Cartesia (with a fallback adapter). The $5 Cartesia plan includes a 3 concurrent limit, which means 3*10=30 concurrent websocket connections.

Not sure if it is relevant: during the simulation, there were multiple interruptions.

Here is the trace back

```
livekit.plugins.cartesia.tts.TTS unexpected error, switching to next TTS
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File \"/usr/local/lib/python3.12/site-packages/livekit/agents/tts/fallback_adapter.py\", line 384, in _try_synthesize
    audio = next_audio_task.result()
            ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File \"/usr/local/lib/python3.12/site-packages/ai_worker/utils/tts_wrapper.py\", line 185, in __anext__
    raise exc from None
  File \"/usr/local/lib/python3.12/site-packages/livekit/agents/tts/tts.py\", line 302, in _main_task
    return await self._run()
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File \"/usr/local/lib/python3.12/site-packages/livekit/plugins/cartesia/tts.py\", line 373, in _run
    async with self._pool.connection() as ws:
               ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File \"/usr/local/lib/python3.12/contextlib.py\", line 210, in __aenter__
    return await anext(self.gen)
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File \"/usr/local/lib/python3.12/site-packages/livekit/agents/utils/connection_pool.py\", line 76, in connection
    conn = await self.get()
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File \"/usr/local/lib/python3.12/site-packages/livekit/agents/utils/connection_pool.py\", line 108, in get
    return await self._connect()
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File \"/usr/local/lib/python3.12/site-packages/livekit/agents/utils/connection_pool.py\", line 59, in _connect
    connection = await self._connect_cb()
                 ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File \"/usr/local/lib/python3.12/site-packages/livekit/plugins/cartesia/tts.py\", line 146, in _connect_ws
    return await asyncio.wait_for(session.ws_connect(url), self._conn_options.timeout)
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File \"/usr/local/lib/python3.12/asyncio/tasks.py\", line 520, in wait_for
    return await fut
           ^^^^^^^^^
  File \"/usr/local/lib/python3.12/site-packages/aiohttp/client.py\", line 949, in _ws_connect

From their documentation:

> If you exceed your WebSocket limit, you will receive a 429 Too Many Requests error on trying to open a new WebSocket connection.

I checked the connection pool implementation, and realized it does not impose any concurrency limit. Could this be the cause for 429? 

I will try to do some experiments for this tomorrow to see if I can replicate/confirm this.

I am trying to modify the chat-ctx in the `on_user_turn_completed`. 

I was trying to follow the example in the docs:
https://docs.livekit.io/agents/start/v0-migration/#before-llm-cb-on-user-turn-completed

Then I wanted to slice the chat history using this code
```   
async def on_user_turn_completed(
        self, chat_ctx: llm.ChatContext, new_message: llm.ChatMessage
    ) -> None:
        # Truncate the context to the last message
        items = chat_ctx.items
        # take the last 2 items
        items = items[-2:]
        
        # Create a new context with truncated items
        new_ctx = ChatContext(items=items)
            
        # explicitly update the context
        await self.update_chat_ctx(new_ctx)

        # log anthropic context

comments.body: I would love to understand how I can continue with an "temporarily changed" chat_ctx after the `on_user_turn_completed` node and how to continue with permanent changes to chat_ctx.

comments.author: longcw
comments.body:
`chat_ctx` of `on_user_turn_completed` is a reference that you can modify it in-place for the current turn (and only for the current turn), it's renamed to `turn_ctx` now.

`self.update_chat_ctx` will modify the global chat ctx (which is not used for the current turn).

So to truncate the chat ctx f

comments.author: longcw
comments.body: and btw, `turn_ctx.items[-10:]` may break the LLM if there are function tools in the chat ctx, openai LLM requires tool calls and tool outputs to be paired, they needs to be removed together. We may provider a helper function for truncating, for now you can check the top of the chat ctx and remove t

issues.title: How to post-process cleanup at time of room completion?
issues.body:
We're in amidst of migrating our v0 code to v1. Our use case involves a possible warm SIP handoff while removing the AI agent so we end up with a Human + Human interaction.

In v0, the shutdown hook that we register doesn't trigger at time of Agent removal.  It only triggers when the room is removed by Livekit due to 0 participants or if we forcibly delete the room. This was desirable as we run some clean up code after.

In v1, the shutdown hook triggers when the Agent is removed from the room.  This seems to be intended behavior based on the description here https://docs.livekit.io/agents/worker/job/#post-processing-and-cleanup. But as soon as this happens (e.g. when we have 2 human participants left in the room), we seem to lose all further control. 

1. Our ctx.room.on("participant_disconnected") hook ceases to be triggered when one or both of the human participants leave the room.
2. The documentation at https://docs.livekit.io/agents/worker/job/#disconnecting-everyone implies that we can register a ctx.room.on("disconnected") hook to perform cleanup when the room is removed. I poked around (and might very well be wrong) but can't seem to find anything indicating where this is emitted in the agents framework and given point 1 above unsure whether it would fire even if implemented.

Would appreciate any guidance.

issues.title: [Livekit Cloud] Not all job requests are emitted to my agent worker with a certain Livekit Cloud project
issues.body:
Hello Livekit team,

I have an issue related to a concurrency scenario and Livekit Cloud (this doesn't happens with a local Livekit server). Basically, when creating rooms and having a participant joining each room, not all the job requests are emitted to my worker.

My first approach to replicate this issue was by using the UI examples available in the docs, I created a monorepo with it, including the agent worker and instructions:

- https://github.com/devniel/livekit-concurrency-example

But then, I used the new `agent-load-test` tool in the Livekit CLI as advised by @yepher  in the Livekit Community Slack, getting the same results. To summarize: 

- 10 rooms created, 1 participant per room.
- Worker only receives 7 events.

Surprisingly, I tested using another Livekit Cloud project and it worked 100% ok, so I'm assuming it's an issue of old Livekit Cloud projects or some sort of regions issues.

Another workaround, can be maybe to add retries based on timeout in the UI.

More info:

- The problematic Livekit Cloud project (missing job requests): rounded-test-2-nixv6gpj.livekit.cloud
- The new Livekit Cloud project (ok): rounded-stress-tests-foro8boz.livekit.cloud

Slack thread: https://livekit-users.slack.com/archives/C048FRL1N2C/p1744980267725499

Thank you!

issues.title: RoomIO.start() throws â€œtext stream handler for topic â€˜lk.chatâ€™ already setâ€ if called twice
issues.body:
Hi team, first of allâ€”thank you for the fantastic work on LiveKit! Iâ€™ve been loving the flexibility of the textâ€stream API.

I ran into a â€œtext stream handler for topic â€˜lk.chatâ€™ already setâ€ error whenever I call RoomIO.start() a second time.

### Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a RoomIO instance and call await roomIO.start().
2. Tear it down (e.g. call await roomIO.aclose(), but note that this does not unregister the text handler).
3. Call await roomIO.start() again.

Youâ€™ll immediately see:
```sh
ValueError: text stream handler for topic 'lk.chat' already set
```

I wondered if we could guard against any leftover handlers by clearing them up front. For example:

```py
async def start(self) -> None:
    self._room._text_stream_handlers.clear()
    # â€¦ rest of start() â€¦
```

Thank you again for all your hard work!

    llm=LLMService(llm_service_name).llm_service,
    tts=TTSService(tts_service_name, tts_voice_id).tts_service,
    chat_ctx=initial_ctx,
    fnc_ctx=fnc_ctx,
    before_llm_cb=_enrich_with_rag,
    preemptive_synthesis=True,
    before_tts_cb=_predicted_text,
    noise_cancellation=noise_cancellation.BVC()
)

if source == 3:
    agent.start(ctx.room, outbound_participant)  # This worked in 0.X
else:
    agent.start(ctx.room)
```

In LiveKit 1.X, the new recommended way appears to be:
```
if source == 3:
    my_agent = OutboundCaller()
else:
    my_agent = Assistant()

session = AgentSession(
    stt=STTService(stt_service_name).stt_service,
    llm=LLMService(llm_service_name).llm_service,
    tts=TTSService(tts_service_name, tts_voice_id).tts_service,
    vad=silero.VAD.load(),
    max_tool_steps=1,
)

await session.start(
    room=ctx.room,
    agent=my_agent,
    room_input_options=RoomInputOptions(
        noise_cancellation=noise_cancellation.BVC()
    )
)
```

But I cannot figure out how to specify or pass outbound_participant to the agent in this new API.

âš™ï¸ Expected Behavior
A way to attach a specific participant (like outbound_participant) when starting the agent, similar to what was possible in LiveKit 0.X.
issues.author: narendra-bluebash

    room_io = RoomIO(
        agent_session=

issues.title: LiveKit 1.0 How to specify voice for Google TTS?
issues.body:
In LiveKit 0.x, we can specify voice for Google TTS using `voice_name` parameter (as string)

In LiveKit 1.0.0rc6, `voice_name` parameter is not allowed. There is `voice` parameter but not as string: 
(https://github.com/livekit/agents/blob/main/livekit-plugins/livekit-plugins-google/livekit/plugins/google/tts.py)
```
class TTS(tts.TTS):
    def __init__(
        self,
        *,
        voice: NotGivenOr[texttospeech.VoiceSelectionParams] = NOT_GIVEN,
        sample_rate: int = 24000,
        pitch: int = 0,
        effects_profile_id: str = "",
        speaking_rate: float = 1.0,
        location: str = "global",
        credentials_info: NotGivenOr[dict] = NOT_GIVEN,
        credentials_file: NotGivenOr[str] = NOT_GIVEN,
    ) -> None:
        """
        Create a new instance of Google TTS.

        Credentials must be provided, either by using the ``credentials_info`` dict, or reading
        from the file specified in ``credentials_file`` or the ``GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS``
        environmental variable.

        Args:
            voice (texttospeech.VoiceSelectionParams, optional): Voice selection parameters.
            sample_rate (int, optional): Audio sample rate in Hz. Default is 24000.
            location (str, optional): Location for the TTS client. Default is "global".
            pitch (float, optional): Speaking pitch, ranging from -20.0 to 20.0 semitones relative to the original pitch. Default is 0.
            effects_profile_id (str): Optional identifier for selecting audio effects profiles to apply to the synthesized speech.
            speaking_rate (float, optional): Speed of speech. Default is 1.0.
            credentials_info (dict, optional): Dictionary containing Google Cloud credentials. Default is None.
            credentials_file (str, optional): Path to the Google Cloud credentials JSON file. Default is None.
        """  # noqa: E501
```
Accordingly, the variants 
`tts=google.TTS(voice="en-US-Standard-D") `
or
`tts=google.TTS(voice_name="en-US-Standard-D")`
result in errors.

By the way, the docs for LiveKit 1.0 still refer to non-existing `voice_name` parameter (https://docs.livekit.io/agents/v1/integrations/tts/google/)

It looks like a bug somewhere here
issues.author: Andhs-eff

comments.author: ChenghaoMou
comments.body:
Have you tried this?

```python
from google.cloud import texttospeech
...

voice = texttospeech.VoiceSelectionParams(
                name="the_name",
                language_code="en-US",
                ssml_gender=SsmlVoiceGender.NEUTRAL,
            )
```

comments.author: Andhs-eff
comments.body: Yeah, it works. But looks a bit cumbersome compared to using other TTS. So, is it a way to go?

comments.author: ChenghaoMou
comments.body:
Honestly, this wouldn't be the first to introduce voice specific settings. e.g. Elevenlabs' voice setting:

DEFAULT_VOICE = Voice(
    id="EXAVITQu4vr4xnSDxMaL",
    name="Bella",
    category="premade",
    settings=VoiceSettings(
        stability=0.71,
        speed=1.0,
        similar
